ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Write a WARC-File with many mets.xml (metadata).
ygData.msgSnippet: Is this in the context of an extension to Heritrix or using the same code elsewhere? It might be tricky to reuse the WARCWriter code elsewhere, given its

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Write a WARC-File with many mets.xml (metadata).
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=s6JCBi3Lt6yfS8twHyzvt5g7ph_LbH4SWtODqi9j5GbF
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Is this in the context of an extension to Heritrix or using the same 
code elsewhere?

It might be tricky to reuse the WARCWriter code elsewhere, given its 
assumptions that it will be handed CrawlURI instances as prefilled by 
Heritrix, but should still be possible. Notably, the 
WARCWriter.writeMetadataRecord() method assumes it will write a set of 
'ANVLRecord' fields (an internal class representing a simple fielded set 
of metadata) rather than any of the other arbitrary kinds of metadata 
that would also be legal by the WARC spec.

Are you calling the "new WARCWriter()" code each time, or reusing one 
'writer' instance for each call to writeMetadataRecord()? (The 
instantiation of a new WARCWriter always starts a new file, never 
appending to an existing file.)

If you are already reusing a single 'writer' properly, perhaps something 
else about your use pattern is triggering the automatic rollover to a 
new file that usually happens only when the max-size is exceeded. I 
would set a breakpoint or other debugging output at WARCWriter's 
createFile method(s), and see what is triggering a new file rather than 
the reuse of the first file.

Hope this helps,

- Gordon @ IA

On 4/1/11 5:31 AM, virginie wrote:
> Hi All,
>
> I would like to write many mets.xml file in one WARC File, but without success.
> At the moment when I write with
> WARCWriter writer = new WARCWriter (aint,dirs,prefix, suffix,compressed,WARCReader.DEFAULT_MAX_WARC_FILE_SIZE,metadata);
> And later
> writer.writeMetadataRecord(.-------)
> I receive per mets.xml file one WARC file but I would like to store all the mets.xml in the one whole WARC-File.
> Any idea why?
> How can I do it?
> Cheers
> Virginie
